reviews.review_msg: Not sure why this prof is getting so much negative feedback when I have had the best experience with her. This class was difficult as POL is not my major but I am so glad I took it with Linda. Yes, her instructions are 6 pages sometimes but she is so detailed and helpful. Even gave us the option to submit an answer for the final to get feedback.

This class was a disaster and a mess, do not take any classes with her if you can avoid it. Long and confusing instructions and never give any grade and feedback to you until the semester end. She can not even post the homework on time. She told you this is an A grade assignment and somehow give you a B at the end. Just do not take her class!!

Do not take any classes from this professor if you can avoid it. Her instructions are very long and confusing. She is disorganized and can't seem to keep up with the course workload. Takes months to get any grades back. She is an incredibly difficult grader and this was a second-year course. Worst professor I've ever had. Avoid her at all costs.

This class was a mess. Every single outline was at least 20 pages so it was hard to understand anything. The syllabus is ridiculously long and confusing, and she doesn't even follow it. You don't get marks until the last minute and communication is a huge problem.

Disorganized professor. Gave us an unreasonable amount of readings each week. Stopped following her syllabus half way through the course because she realized she could not keep up with the markings for the homework she gave out herself. She also handed back most of the assignments after the final exam. It was very difficult to get feedback.

I selected "not sure yet" for my grade and I don't think I will ever know what it is. Linda takes MONTHS to mark, is EXTREMELY disorganized, and does not follow any structure at all. The topics each week are almost completely random. Linda marks unfairly. I am considering getting help for emotional/mental damage after taking a course with Linda.

Terrible experience. She is an incredibly slow marker, gives an absurd amount of meaningless readings, and has horrible communication skills. Her OUTLINES for projects, tests, and assignments ranged from 11 to more than 20 pages in length. She is unable to succinctly summarize information, resulting in mass confusion. Avoid her classes!

Syllabus and project guidelines are all SUPER disorganized. She takes MONTHS to mark work. Final is due today but still no midterm grades. Doesn't communicate at all with TA-I feel bad for him. Lectures and readings are all super long (avg 60 pgs/week) with no benefit. She doesn't understand you have other classes. Don't take this as a GPA booster

Yikes. This is probably the worst class I've taken ever. It was terribly organized and extremely poor communication on Dr. Elmose's part left my mental health in shambles. I would avoid her classes at all costs. Very dissapointing.

Her Canvas page was full of clutter, making it hard to navigate. Her Tutorials were okay, but the overall class structure was pathetic. She's probably a better prof in person, but I wouldn't count on it. Don't take the course as a GPA booster, her weekly readings are very time-consuming, and so are the discussion questions.

Linda cares, she gives detailed and helpful feedback. Course outlines are well organized. Though she herself can be disorganized, she does grant extensions for about every assignment. The only thing is that she gives a lot of work: heavy readings, lots of small assignments, etc. But if you can handle it, she makes you a better writer and student.

Enjoyed my class with Linda and learned a lot. She really cares and was flexible with deadlines due to remote learning. As noted elsewhere lectures were a bit disorganized because she tries to cover too much. Fair marker and readings/participation were pretty standard for a 300 level course (2-4h a week)
She made me do 50 sit-ups.....

Linda was everywhere with the material, it seems as though she was unfamiliar with the topics herself. I bought the textbook and didn't read it once, her lecture slides summarizes it all. If you're good at writing essays this class is an easy A. Overall lectures are dull, but marking was fair.
Awful awful awful, lazy herself but unreasonable expectations. 1/10 would not recommend.

worst prof ive ever had, unclear project instructions, ridiculous course load (doesnt understand that you have other classes, a job and a life), tests are impossible to study for. incredibly lazy prof, just reads off slides and does a horrible job of teaching. could've learned more just reading the textbook on my own. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF'S CLASS.

4 weeks late on lecture material. Still forced us to be examined on the material she wasn't able to cover. Left assignments unmarked and only provided our assignment marks AFTER the exam was over. This left little room for improvement prior to the exam. Comments on essays do not correspond with grade received. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Worst prof ever, so disorganized and unfair. Interesting to see that she used to teach at SFU but now is at Okanagan College, why would she go from a top ranked university to a sucky community college (I go to OC so I can say this). Must be because she is not a very good prof.

She's enthusiastic about the course content and makes a concerted effort to have students be involved and ponder the implications of the material (which there is a lot of). If the class is outgoing then she can facilitate a great seminar experience, but if people aren't interested in talking then the class can end up feeling more like a lecture.
I really enjoyed the class and the feedback.  She is no longer with SFU but at Okanagan College and we have gained what SFU lost.  I recommend her classes

Very intellegent woman, but all over the board (literally) in lectures. she jumps from topic to topic often and doesn't usually pull them all together to form a conclusive point by the end of class. It would be nice if she could wrap everything up at the end of each class so we aren't left scatterbrained and confused.

I will echo what everyone else is saying, Linda is slow to provide feedback on assignments and her lectures are all over the map, seems like she puts no effort into preparing for class. Don't take a class with Linda unless you absolutely have to.

You must attend lectures and participate for marks.  She has strong biases in her material, so don't expect a wide variety of viewpoints.  A nice lady, but not the best professor.  Her lectures have 100+ slides per lecture, and she goes all over the place with them, so there is no real precision to the lectures.  OK overall, but not an easy marker.
Worst professor in the Political Science department at SFU!

Not helpful when asked. Provides feedback very late so it is not useful to improve on work. Lectures are very dry despite the class subject material being very interesting to me. She is not proficient with technology or she is lazy so she has no notes prepared.  Disorganized and not engaged. Avoid her at all costs.

She's a pretty easy grader and as long as you make an effort to participate in discussion posts and work on your final essay, you'll do fine. The final was pretty easy as well, and she was very generous in giving out marks. While she does respond very slowly, her comments are valuable and informative.

I really enjoyed having classes with Linda. Very knowledgeable, enthusiastic,and easygoing prof. Lectures are long, but interesting and she makes class fun. I already took 2 classes with her and  would take again if I had the opportunity. Mostly take home final exam and fair amounts of assignments.

POL-343 is the worst class i have taken during my undergrad. Linda provides little to no assistance, feedback was given so late that it was hard to improve on papers, i had to keep sending her emails to get a response. Whoa too much stress, not worth it at all!

I really enjoyed having Linda as a professor. Very understanding, and helpful. Gives great feedback. Lectures are long, but interesting and she makes class fun. Would take again if I had the opportunity.

She is the reason I will never do online classes again. She takes forever to mark and respond. I never received my paper back and basically had to beg for it back and then she stopped replying to my emails. My final grade was not justified and when I asked her to clarify? Again, never replied. She is an absolute joke - do NOT take her class!

Linda is probably one of the best instructors in the Poli Sci department.  She puts a lot of work into her lectures and is always willing to help students.  Lectures can get a bit long but they really are useful.  Grading wise, she's a bit tough but she gives a lot of help if you ask.

Linda is a very helpful prof.  I took the online version of GPE (Poli 343) with her and she is the only thing that gave me motivation throughout the course because the readings are numerous and  aside from the O+W text all of the material was left-wing borderline communist propaganda. Linda did not write the course herself.  Avoid the course online

Response times were ridiculously slow. But her feedback was some of the best I have ever received from a prof, so I guess it balances out. She definitely goes the extra mile to help you when you have questions, and her grading was quite fair.
Great prof :) Extremely helpful and caring. Goes the extra mile to give you helpful feedback and answers your questions thoroughly. Humble and passionate about what she teaches!

What a horrible class. I did it Distance Ed. Linda had no idea how to use WebCT and response times were slow. I asked her what the class average was for the midterm-she didnt have it. Asked her for a breakdown of marks at the end of term-twice- and havent heard back. Maybe she is better in class but definitely do not take distance ed with her.

Yeah, the lectures were kind of disorganized. A heavy reading load was assigned. She did, however, personally mark the essays and exams for a class of over 70 students and provide plenty of feedback (at least on the first paper). I do agree that what we were expected to have learned at the end of the course was not clear.

Everybody in the class that I have talked to said that they loved her POL 449 class and that they would miss the class. I highly recommend the professor, especially for seminar courses. The professor is very fair and caring. You will develop the skills that you should develop from obtaining university education.

Linda is disorganized. The subject material isn't placed in a coherent manner. It felt like I received a superficial understanding of International Organizations and IR...I wish there was a textbook. Also, Linda objectives are not clear. By the time the final roles around, it is still unclear what she expects us to know and understand.

It really surprises me to see so many rate her as easy. That is not my impression at all. On the contrary. For each of my assignments, some of her criticisms have been unfair and her marking surprisingly hard. I also found her lectures to be dry and really not as interesting as I had hoped from this class.

You need to attend class and take good notes - they can save a lot of time on the take home midterm and final.  Good lectures, though a bit disorganized.  She improved throughout the term.  She really emphasizes developing a good general knowledge.  Provides a great suggested reading list, I used it for research papers for my other classes.

I ended up teaching my self. She is an awesome person and really smart. But super dis organized, all over the place. It is her first year teaching so i cut her some slack. But don't go into the class expecting to learn a lot! She hardly used the material and her notes in class are horrible, chicken scratch! I gave  up on taking notes!

Brand new prof.  Really nice and caring.  My only complaint was we had too much reading (5 articles 40 pages each per week) and 80% of the readings were never discussed at all.  Doesn't reply to emails and seldom available because of her demanding research schedule.  Not really her fault.  I enjoyed the class
